row.entry: Adds a constant to the input: youtk = yk + c
Compares value against a threshold, and optionally replaces it with a constant
Discards values outside the [t1, t2] interval
Substracts the previous value from every value: youtk = yk - yk-1
Calculates the difference quotient of every value and the subsequent one: youtk = (yk+1-yk) / (tk+1-tk)
Divides input by a constant: youtk = yk / a
Divides input by the current time: youtk = yk / tk
Evaluates an arbitrary expression. Use t for time, y for value, and tprev, yprev for the previous values.
Integrates the input as a step function (sample-hold or backward-sample-hold) or with linear interpolation
Adds linear component to input series: youtk = yk + a * tk
Computes input modulo a constant: youtk = yk % a
Applies the exponentially weighted moving average filter: youtk = youtk-1 + alpha*(yk-youtk-1)
Multiplies input by a constant: youtk = a * yk
Replaces every value with the mean of values in the window: youtk = SUM(yi,i=k-winsize+1..k)/winsize
Sums up values: youtk = SUM(yi, i=0..k)
Calculates the time average of the input (integral divided by time)
Returns the difference in time between this and the previous value: youtk = tk - tk-1
Shifts the input series in time by a constant: toutk = tk + dt
Replaces time values with their index: toutk = k
Calculates batched average: replaces every `winsize' input values with their mean. Time is the time of the first value in the batch.
